title: Curator's Insight: "In a Cloud, in a Wall, in a Chair: Six Modernists in Mexico at Midcentury"
title_display: Curator's Insight Featuring In a Cloud, in a Wall, in a Chair: Six Modernists in Mexico at Midcentury
hero_caption: Clara Porset. Butaque, about 1955–56. Gálvez Guzzy Family/Casa Gálvez Collection. Photo by Rodrigo Chapa
short_description: Zoë Ryan, John H. Bryan Chair and Curator of Architecture and Design, provides insight into her latest exhibition showcasing six female artists working in Mexico in the height of the modern period.
list_description: Zoë Ryan, John H. Bryan Chair and Curator of Architecture and Design, provides insight into her latest exhibition showcasing six female artists working in Mexico in the height of the modern period.
description:
Zoë Ryan, John H. Bryan Chair and Curator of Architecture and Design, provides insight into her latest exhibition showcasing six female artists working in Mexico and highlighting their contributions to Mexico's rich artistic landscape at the height of the modern period. This lecture will be accompanied by a private exhibition viewing and cocktail reception.

Please note that this event is only open to current Sustaining Fellows. Learn more about the Sustaining Fellows here.

Registration is required. Please call the Office of the Sustaining Fellows at (312) 443-3735 or email sustainingfellows@artic.edu to register.
